name: GlaucusResearch
tweet: We call on $BLA Blue Sky to provide the same level of transparency as the asset managers to which it compares itself and provide a breakdown of fee earning and non-fee earning AUM by fund, complete with disclosures on realized and unrealized valuation and IRRs.  #ASX

name: GlaucusResearch
tweet: Only after Glaucus exposed Blue Sky for overstating its fee earning AUM (as calculated in the same way as other alt. asset managers), that $BLA says such comparisons are unfair.  But this is exactly how $BLA pitched itself to the market: as a Brisbane based wanna-be $KKR  #ASX

name: GlaucusResearch
tweet: $BLA Blue Sky’s response is woefully inadequate.  Rather than address our Report on its merits, Blue Sky has doubled down on obfuscating simple details about its business.  Instead of transparency, Blue Sky has fallen back on threats and recriminations. #ASX

name: GlaucusResearch
tweet: Glaucus Issues a Comprehensive Rebuttal to Blue Sky $BLA #ASX   https://t.co/Irym6qUXXd

name: GlaucusResearch
tweet: We believe Blue Sky $BLA compensates for its overstated fee earning AUM by charging clients egregious management fees, which can reach up to 17% of the capital invested in Blue Sky funds and are charged irrespective of the performance of the underlying investment.

name: GlaucusResearch
tweet: Over time, when Blue Sky $BLA inappropriately inflates the value of unrealized investments, its receivables balloon with uncollected performance and management fees and cash flows deteriorate despite record paper profits.

name: GlaucusResearch
tweet: Just an example of how absurdly $BLA Blue Sky marks up its investments: we calculate $BLA values 12 beach burrito joints at +$60 million. Take a look: would you pay $5 million for one of those restaurants?  https://t.co/E4WpR2oyDT

name: GlaucusResearch
tweet: We also believe that $BLA Blue Sky has been overstating its financial performance by aggressively, and unjustifiably, marking up the value of its unrealized assets. #ASX

name: GlaucusResearch
tweet: Based on our analysis, we estimate that $BLA Blue Sky’s real fee earning AUM is at most $1.5 billion, 63% less than Blue Sky’s reported figure.  #ASX $BLA

name: GlaucusResearch
tweet: We believe that Blue Sky $BLA is significantly overstating its fee earning AUM by reporting the gross value of certain assets as AUM instead of the fair value of the capital invested.  #ASX $BLA

name: GlaucusResearch
tweet: Glaucus is short Blue Sky Alternative Investments (ASX: BLA).  We value shares of $BLA at AU$<2.66, 77% lower than current prices.  #ASX $BLA
